title: Regalix Positions 'Organic' as the Preferred Search Marketing Strategy among Companies Globally
text:
Submitted by admin on 9/9/2015 @ 2:19 PM   Regalix 
PALO ALTO, Calif., Sept. 9, 2015 /PRNewswire-iReach/ -- Search engines are improving their ability to recognize high-quality web content and ignore inferior content. Formulaic campaigns have almost no chance of success. The good news is many SEO experts can produce desired results and work out campaigns that meets your objectives. Search Marketing is a fast-changing activity where marketer are constantly evolving the right mix to suit their need to improve visibility, making outsourcing the most viable option. Through its latest research Regalix's studies Search Marketing's most popular strategies, tactics and metrics. 
Photo - http://photos.prnewswire.com/prnh/20150909/264796 
Majority Companies Invest In Search Marketing 
73 percent of respondents said their companies invest in Search Marketing. In fact, 37% of companies said they have been using Search Marketing for over 5 years now. As far as the organic versus paid argument goes, 76 percent of marketers we spoke to, said they considered both SEO & SEM as part of their Search Marketing strategy. Interestingly, 66 percent of marketers rated organic search over paid search in terms of performance both during the pre-sales and post-sales stages of the customer's buying cycle, laying to rest the conjecture that consumers have greater faith in results of organic search. According to Nimish Vohra, Senior Vice President-Regalix, "a combination of paid and organic search strategies seem to bring in better results. So, content is important, as is integrating search efforts with Mobile Marketing & Social Media." 
Remarketing & Dynamic Remarketing-Top Choices for Improving Revisits 
90 percent of respondents chose 'increasing lead generation' as the key objective of their Search Marketing strategy, followed by 50 percent who said their key search objective was to increase website traffic. Most respondents picked remarketing and dynamic remarketing to target people who have already visited their website. Among the respondents who said they used remarketing, AdWords came out as the most popular platform with an 80% response rate. 
The report brings out 2015's latest trends related to mobile and social media search as well, with the better part of marketer's predicting a growth in investment of the channel.
